color.title: Color
color.desc1: The colors in our design system are based off of the naming convention used by Tailwind CSS, which combines color names with numerical scales to indicate variations in lightness and saturation. The scale generally goes from 50 to 950, with 50 being the lightest variant and 950 being the darkest.
color.basicOverviewDesc: Here is the basic overview of The Design Systemâ€™s color naming system:

basicOveview1.title: Color Names:
basicOveview1.content: {title} Basic colors are named with common names such as red, blue, green, yellow, etc.

basicOveview2.title: Color Variants:
basicOveview2.content: {title} Each basic color is further divided into a range of variants from 50 to 950, denoting different shades of that color. A lower number indicates a lighter shade, while a higher number indicates a darker shade. For example, red-50, red-100, ..., red-950.

basicOveview3.title: Utilizing Colors:
basicOveview3.content: {title} In Tailwind CSS, these colors are used as utility classes in your HTML files. For instance, to set the background color to a light red, you might use a class like bg-red-50.
